profileText: A Senator from Indiana; born near Sugar Tree Ridge, Concord Township, Highland County, Ohio, October 6, 1862; attended the common schools; graduated from Indiana Asbury (now DePauw) University, Greencastle, Ind., in 1885; studied law; admitted to the bar in 1887 and commenced practice in Indianapolis, Ind.; elected as a Republican to the United States Senate on January 17, 1899, reelected in 1905, and served from March 4, 1899, until March 3, 1911; unsuccessful candidate for reelection in 1910; chairman, Committee on Forest Reservations and Game Protection (Fifty-sixth Congress), Committee on Territories (Fifty-seventh through Sixty-first Congresses), Committee on Indian Depredations (Fifty-ninth Congress); returned to Indianapolis and engaged in literary and historical pursuits; unsuccessful Progressive candidate for Governor of Indiana in 1912; chairman of the National Progressive Convention at Chicago in 1912; unsuccessful candidate as a Progressive in 1914 and as a Republican in 1922 for election to the United States Senate; died in Indianapolis, Ind., April 27, 1927; interment in Crown Hill Cemetery.

researchRecord.name: 1890-1927. 418 containers. Correspondence, addresses, articles, writings and drafts, interviews, diary, notes, office files, files of Committee on Territories and Insular Affairs, and photographs. The papers document his career from his early law practice through his Senate service, his espousal of the Progressive party, 1912-1916, his experience as a war correspondent in Europe, and his later work as a historian and biographer. Finding aid.

Items concerning Beveridge's manuscripts in the Frank Heywood Hodder correspondence, 1925-1935; and correspondence in Arthur Ernest Morgan papers, 1883-1962; Ernest Irving Lewis papers, 1897-1944; and in the Stanley Washburn papers, 1912-1945.
1 volume of research materials gathered by Beveridge; and 6 letters in various collections.
Correspondence in the Chase Salmon Osborn papers, 1889-1949; Thomas Clarkson Trueblood papers, 1886-1946; John J. Carton papers, 1883-1921; and Henry Moore Bates papers, 1886-1950. Finding aid.
Correspondence in the Anson Phelps Stokes family papers, 1761-1960; Beer family papers, 1740-1981 (bulk 1827-1981); and Charles Dewey Hilles papers, 1885-1955.

In addition to the institutions listed above, items are also cataloged in collections at: American Antiquarian Society, Worcester, MA; Brown University, John Hay Archives, Providence, RI; Cornell University Library, Ithaca, NY; Dartmouth College, Hanover, NH; Harvard University, Houghton Library, Cambridge, MA; Harvard University Archives, Cambridge, MA; Historical Society of Pennsylvania, Philadelphia, PA; Rockefeller Archive Center, North Tarrytown, NY; Rutgers University Libraries, New Brunswick, NJ; Smithsonian Institution, Archives of American Art, Washington, DC; State Historical Society of Wisconsin, Madison, WI; and University of Oklahoma, Norman, OK.
